org.jamsim.math

Class IntervalsIntMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamsim.math.IntervalsIntMap

  • public class IntervalsIntMap
extends Object
    Maps a set of contiguous intervals on the real number line to a set of integer values. Allows the creation of a probability distribution from which a sample can be taken by calling getMappedValue(double) with a random number.
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    Oliver Mannion

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntervalsIntMap

        public IntervalsIntMap(double leftBound,
               double[] rightBounds,
               int[] values)
        Construct a contiguous set of intervals. The bottom of the range is specified by leftBound. Each interval is specified by the previous bound and its right bound, specified in rightBounds. eg: (a,b], (b,c], (c,d], where a = leftBound and b, c, d equal rightBounds[0], rightBounds[1], rightBounds[2] respectively.
        Parameters:
        leftBound - the bottom of the interval range.
        rightBounds - array, sorted from lowest to highest, of successive right bounds of each interval
        values - the set of values mapped to by each interval

    • Method Detail

      • getIntervals

        public double[] getIntervals()
        Return all intervals, including the lowest bound (ie: the left bound).
        Returns:
        array of the left bound and all right bounds.

      • getRightBounds

        public double[] getRightBounds()
        Return the right bounds; exclude the lowest bound (ie: the left bound).
        Returns:
        array of all right bounds.

      • getValues

        public int[] getValues()
        Get the values that the intervals map to.
        Returns:
        values array

      • newProbabilityDistribution

        public static IntervalsIntMap newProbabilityDistribution(double[] probabilities,
                                         int[] values)
        Creates a new instance by generating the right bounds through accumulation of probabilities.
        Parameters:
        probabilities - individual probabilities of each value. These are sequentially added (accumulated) to the sum of the previous probabilities of previous values to generate the right bound.
        values - values that map to probabilities
        Returns:
        intervals, from 0 (exclusive) - 1 (inclusive), mapped to value. Or in other words, a cumulative distribution of probabilities mapped to an integer value.

      • getMappedValue

        public int getMappedValue(double x)
        Return the mapped value that is less than or equal to x but not less than then next lowest right bound. In other words, return the mapped value for the interval (a,b] ie: {x E R | a < x <= b}. When x is a random number from a uniform distribution, then this acts as a sampling operation.
        Parameters:
        x - right bound of this probability band
        Returns:
        mapped value

      • binarySearchLower

        public static int binarySearchLower(double[] array,
                    double key,
                    double delta)
        Returns the index of the greatest array value strictly less than the given key.
        Parameters:
        array - an array sorted from lowest to highest
        key - key
        delta - the distance between the key and the array value that is allowed for the 2 values to be considered equal.
        Returns:
        the index of the greatest key strictly less than the given key, or -1 if no array values are less than key.

      • sumArray

        public static double sumArray(double[] array)
        Return the sum of all the values in array.
        Parameters:
        array - double values to sum
        Returns:
        sum of double values in array.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • drawIndexFromProbs

        public static int drawIndexFromProbs(boolean[] includeProb,
                     double[] probabilities,
                     double random)
        Draw from a distribution of probabilities. First, create a probability distribution (ie: IntervalsIntMap) from the set of probabilities that are included (i.e.: includeProb[i] = true). Second, using random select a probability interval and return its index.
        Parameters:
        includeProb - the set of all probabilities to include. Only where includeProb[i] = true will that probability be used to create the CD.
        probabilities - the probability of all conditions. Only the probabilities of conditions that are true in includeProb will be used to create the cumulative distribution.
        random - a random number in the range (0,1].
        Returns:
        an index in the range [0, includeProb.length]. This is the position of the probability in the includeProb array.
